jinngine.util
Class Heap<T>

java.lang.Object
  jinngine.util.Heap<T>

public class Heap<T>
extends java.lang.Object

Minimum heap implementation. See [Cormen et al 1999] for formal theory. Maintains all elements in a min-heap, such that the minimum element will be the top-most node in the heap at all times. Among many other uses, heaps are ideal for representing priority queues.

insert

public void insert(T element)
Insert element into the heap. O(lg n) where n is the number of elements/nodes in the heap

Parameters:
element - new element to be inserted

clear

public final void clear()

top

public final T top()
Return a reference to the top-most element on the heap. The method does not change the state of the heap in any way. O(k).

Returns:
Reference to top-most element of heap

pop

public T pop()
Pop an element of the heap. O(lg n) where n is the number of elements in heap.
